page.title: 09A Guisborough Doctor's p.m.
page.content: 1.00-1.45 is his lunch break but there are usually meetings to attend such as Rotary Club or Round Table - often very boring. Afterwards, another round of visits and a meeting with a drug salesman. 4-4.30 is a rest time (in the office) which he tries to keep free. 4.30-6, another surgery, today dominated by a minor outbreak of yellow fever at the local compre- hensive.Last is a young mother & baby with colic. Home to supper at 6.30 (mince & yorkshire pud.) Evenings he is usually at political or medical meetings or socialising. Today was the local drama soc's production of 'Abig- ail's Party' at Gisborough Hall which they much enjoyed. Home about 11 & off to bed.Dr Galbraith's days are full & energetic,especially compared to the empty days of so many of his jobless patients.
